course_description: The course is structured along the "life cycle" of a firm, covering the following topics: (1) Early-stage financing and IPO, introduction of financing securities, and how they align entrepreneurs with their capital providers. (2) Financial management of a publicly traded firm (or mature private firm): Optimal capital structure; merger and acquisitions, risk management, corporate control and takeovers, and shareholder activism. (3) Going private/buyout, and bankruptcy. The course immerses with issues an executive, investor, a banker, or an analyst encounters, and connects to current issues.
